metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19790 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An open redirect was discovered in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.50, 2.8.x before 2.8.49, 3.x before 3.4.20, 4.0.x before 4.0.15, 4.1.x before 4.1.9 and 4.2.x before 4.2.1. By using backslashes in the `_failure_path` input field of login forms, an attacker can work around the redirection target restrictions and effectively redirect the user to any domain after login.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-all-my-sms-notifier - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
php-symfony-amazon-sns-notifier - 3.4.20+dfsg-1
